post: – This is the forum/thread I’ve been participating on since 2/12. I haven’t done very well and could use a lot of help — especially, with research and answers to their numerous questions and claims. – For instance, how do we explain the “banding” that remains identical from the main body of the Shroud to, and through, the sample — if we think that significant reweaving is required to account for 1300 years in the dating? – Thanks. — Rich Savage (Jabba).
title: A bit of interweaving in the Arizona sample?
